entry.title: Error when implement SAP Notes 3308470.
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

We encountered issues implementing SAP Notes 3308470, with the error message "Invalid_DEFAULT_FILE_NAME" does not exist (shown in the attached screenshot). Our SAP specification is SAP_BASIS 701 SP 00006. Please help us solve this issue.

entry.title: component consumption in a multilevel BOM in an order
entry.content:
Hello All

I want to create a functional specification for a Z report. I have a multi-level Bill of Materials (BOM), and I need to determine how much quantity of raw material N1 is used in finished material F1. However, N1 is not a direct component of F1’s BOM—it appears at a lower level in the BOM hierarchy. Although N1 is also used in other finished materials, I want to calculate only the quantity consumed in the production of F1.

I don't want this qty from BOM qty which will be available in CS11 or CS 12 report. I want qty of N1 as per daily confirmation done by user because F1 t N1 qty ratio is not constant.


Thank you

entry.title: Oracle on Linux Refresh Procedure
entry.content:
Hello,

Recently our systems migrated from Windows to Linux.
Our database backups are configured in networker tool. Both our application and database are on different servers.
Our concern, after OS migration we have been requested from the client to perform system refresh.
For that we are targeting our sandbox system i.e. we need to refresh our sandbox system with the production data.

Problem we are facing : 
We don't have any system refresh procedure for the Linux operating system.
We are not sure just by moving only .anf file (backup file) from source to the target system  will perform restore.
We would like to know from you what could be the refresh procedure and what will be the files we need to move from source to the target.

Note : We want to perform the restore with brtool option.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Consignment stock 3 not set in production order component
entry.content:
Hello,

We have set the component as a consignment material. Special procurement 10.

All settings are done in system, component is not batch managed material. When we create production order the special stock indicator 3 consignment is not set automatically. We need to do in manually. As we are using MES system for order handling we need this marker to be set on order creation cause if it is not than also it is not in the IDOC.

Thanks

entry.title: How to Join IDoc data (EDID4) with MSEG to Map REM Yield/Consumption to Planned Orders in SQVI?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm trying to create a custom report for our business user in SQVI to replicate the output of MB51, which I want to display the REM planned order number associated with each yield/consumption posting. Current challenge that I'm facing is that in REM, once the MES system sends data via IDoc, the postings are created in SAP against a cost collector (unlike discrete manufacturing whereby the postings will be against a production order).

My objective:

1. To build a report that mimics MB51 (based on MSEG + MKPF).

2. In the report each yield and consumption posting will be linked to each planned order.

3. The report also can be filtered by posting/entry dates.

 

I have done a bit of study and I've found that these tables below contains the information that I need in the report:

1. EDID4: Contains SData which includes the planned/work order, material, plant, etc.

2. EDIDC: Contains the timestamp of the IDoc

3. MSEG: Material document items

4. MKPF: For header data

 

So the challenge that I face:

1. The planned order number is available inside EDID4-SData as part of raw string.

2. There is no common fields that can link EDID4 with MSEG

3. SQVI does not support parsing SData, so I cannot extract the planned order field directly.

4. I have tried to join PLAF with MSEG + MKPF, however once I have generated the report, the planned order number is incorrectly mapped to each transaction. For example, even though I have filtered the transaction date as 30th July, there are old planned orders (May planned orders) and planned orders that yet to release (Dec 2025 planned orders) are displayed in the report. 

 

Is there any way to make this work in SQVI? Or is a custom ABAP/Z-table is the only viable path? Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: Adoption of PO price from purchase requisition for confugured material
entry.content:
Hello,

We have a configured material whose price in the purchase requisition is determined by the BOM for our intercompany process ( we developed some logic to transfer the EK02 condition from sales order to PREQ). The problem come when converting the purchase requisition to a PO. The PO overwrites the PREQ price with either PIR or last PO price, I understand this is standard SAP behaviour.

My question is is there a way to default the PREQ price automatically for configured materials when converting to PO.

Many thanks

entry.content:

There is an option in menu also.

Maint Notification-Order-Create-Direct and background....this option also be disabled.

Regards,

M.K.M

entry.title: Request for Information About Getting a SAP License for Academic Teaching
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am a university lecturer at the Faculty of Economics and Management in Sfax (Tunisia), and I am in charge of teaching the course Enterprise Resource Planning Systems to students in business and computer science.

As part of this course, I would like to introduce SAP as a practical tool to help students become familiar with a real-world ERP system.

I would like to know:

-Is there a version of SAP specifically intended for academic use?

- How can I obtain a free or discounted license for educational purposes?

- What are the eligibility criteria and application steps?

Thank you in advance for your guidance and any shared experiences.
Best regards,
FAHMI BARGUI
University Lecturer
University of Sfax – Tunisia

BR.

entry.title: Ordem de venda considerando preço errado
Request for Information About Getting a SAP License for Academic Teaching
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am a university lecturer at the Faculty of Economics and Management in Sfax (Tunisia), and I am in charge of teaching the course Enterprise Resource Planning Systems to students in business and computer science.

As part of this course, I would like to introduce SAP as a practical tool to help students become familiar with a real-world ERP system.

I sent two requests for Educational License of SAP Software for Academic Use (to sapnextgen@sap.com and webmaster@sap.com) on behalf of my university six days ago (on July 30, 2025), but I have not received any response until today.

In addition, I also accessed the Academic Alliances website and clicked on the "Contact us to become a member" button. I filled out the form to request an Educational License of SAP Software for Academic Use on behalf of my university, but I have not received any reply either.

Is there anyone who can help me obtain this license, especially since the academic year is starting soon and I need the SAP tool for my practical sessions?

Best regards

entry.title: Certain number of POs that are missing the date line milestone Me21n
entry.content: We notice that our prod. FMS system randomly creates certain Purchase Orders with wrongly Datelines: Dates in the Date Line Tab within me21n. As mentioned , it is random therefore the issue is not yet recreate it in our pre - prod environment nevertheless the number of POs is bigger each day. It seems is not user specific nor article specific. We had consult a few post at "SAP community" and this SAP Note : 2358654 which may not apply to us ( note is very old released) and our current system seems higher / updated recently . Can you please advise ?

entry.title: SD: Rounding differences in invoicing
entry.content:
When invoicing an SD order with the following conditions:

For 6 pieces at 35,000.00 Euro each, a 9% percentage surcharge is configured. SAP correctly calculates this surcharge to be 3,150.00 Euro per piece.

However, this only occurs once you navigate to the header conditions.
However, during the invoicing process, the system calculates a surcharge of 3,149.98 Euro, resulting in a 2-cent rounding difference.

Bei der Fakturierung eines SD-Auftrages mit folgenden Konditionen:

6 Stück zu 35.000,00 Euro wird ein prozentualer Zuschlag von 9% hinterlegt und SAP ermittelt korrekt einen Zuschlag von 3.150,00 Euro pro Stück.
Bei der Fakturierung wird dann allerdings ein Zuschlag von3.149,98 ermittelt und 2 Cent werden als Rundungsdifferenz ausgewiesen. 

Dies geschieht allerdings erst, wenn man einmal in die Kopfkonditionen wechselt.

entry.title: Issue with Automatic Inspection plan assignment to inspection lot
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

Need your valuable inputs on an issue which we are facing now.

We have a Material with MPN maintained but being procured from two different vendors but from the same Manufacturer. The requirement is to assign two different plans for the Material - Vendor combinations because one would go for reduced inspection and other will remain on full inspection. Below are the settings maintained:

1. Automatic assignment of Task List is checked in Material Master.

2. Two separate Inspection Plans created. Group Counter 1 with DMR assigned and assigned to Material - Vendor 1. Group Counter 2 without DMR and assigned to Material - Vendor 2. Both the plans of the respective operations and MICs assigned and have usage 5.

3. DMR is created for reduced inspection.

4. Quality Level via QDL1 created for Material - Manufacturer combination.

After this, when Inspection Lot is created post GR - it's not considering the Group Counter 2 and automatically assigning the Group Counter 1 for the Inspection Lot with Vendor 2 as well.

For both the cases, it's assigning the Group Counter 1.

Please help in resolving this as we are not sure if we missed something or overlooking something which is required.
Thanks a lot!!!

entry.title: How to change existing hierarchy in PRODHS fields according to SAP note 1070939 ?
entry.content:
Hi everyone

We modified structure PRODHS over a decade ago, and this how it looks like today:

component | type
ZZPRODH1 | PRODH1
ZZPRODH2 | PRODH2
ZZPRODH3 | PRODH3
ZZPRODH4 | PRODH4
ZZPRODH5 | PRODH5
ZZPRODH6 | PRODH6

Recently, we've stumbled upon SAP Note 1070939 - Consulting: Changing the product hierarchy structure PRODHS - SAP for Me , where the recommendation is to name the first 3 components without ZZ prefix (so leaving the name to the names delivered by SAP), and only to add ZZ prefix for additional fields. We modified the fields years and years before the note was published.

In our S/4 system one SAP ABAP class couldn't be activated, because the testclass of this ABAP class expected the PRODH fields 1-3 to exist in PRODS structure. This is the only issue we've identified so far, everything else seems to work despite difference to recommendation of note 1070939.

 

We can't just rename the PRODHS structure components, because we have dozens of generated SD condition tables (Axxx) where the first three PRODHS fields with ZZ prefix are used. 

Has anybody (had) the same challgenge? Did you solve it? Did you leave it? Did you experience anything not to work?

Thanks!

entry.title: Short Dump error KE549 in CO-PA postings
entry.content:
We get ABAP dump during FI posting for new Company Code with error message KE549 in CO-PA posting.

ST22 Details

Cancelled Program:  RK2A0010_UPDATE

Application Component: CO-PA-PMS

Long text of error message:
 Diagnosis
     An undefined status has been discovered in the data basis for
     Profitability Analysis (CO-PA). The system cannot continue
     processing.
     Aids in diagnosing the problem:
     DIAG1 = "FBB1"
     DIAG2 = "0010"
     DIAG3 = "AUD"
     DIAG4 = "USD"

 Procedure
     Look in OSS for notes regarding error message KE549. The problem
     may have already be known.
     If you do not find a note, open a problem message in OSS and
     include the following information:
     o   What did you do to get this error? Indicate the transaction
         code, menu steps, or executed program that led to this message.
     o   Indicate all the necessary entries you made on any selections
         screens or dialog boxes that might help reproduce the problem.
     o   Make a note of the values listed above (DIAG1 through DIAG4).
     o   If this message appears in a short dump, specify the system and
         the application server in which you received the dump.

 Technical information about the message:
 Message class....... "KE"
 Number.............. 549
 Variable 1.......... "FBB1"
 Variable 2.......... 0010
 Variable 3.......... "AUD"
 Variable 4.......... "USD"

We found an OSS Note related to this dump - 1746096 - Short Dump with KE549 in CO-PA postings.  This note mentions about Pilot note 2377261.

  • Apply Pilot note 2377261. Please contact SAP Support if you would like to be added to the pilot note.
